page.title: 03Raithby Village.
page.content: I live in Raithby, a small village situated two miles from the market town of Spilsby. There are no shops left in the village now, but there used to be a post office, a bakers shop, a laundry and a blacksmith's forge. It is not very long ago that everybody who lived in the village also worked here. Most people used either to work on the estate for the squire or on one of the two farms. The others worked in the shops. Today, everybody works outside Raithby except the two farmers. There is in the village a church,a chapel, an inn and a village hall that used to be the old school. I live in a big house which was converted from a barn in a farm yard The yard is now our garden.
